snippet: Noor Islamic Bank said on Wednesday that it “took pre-emptive action” when it learned that the United States planned to sanction some Iranian banks.
abstract: Noor Islamic Bank in the United Arab Emirates says that it 'took pre-emptive action' to end business relationships with some Iranian banks when it learned that the United States planned to apply economic sanctions against those banks.

byline.contributor: Artin Afkhami contributed reporting from Boston, and Annie Lowrey from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Noor Islamic Bank said on Wednesday that it “took pre-emptive action” when it learned that the United States planned to sanction some Iranian banks.

headline.seo: Noor Islamic Cuts Ties With Iranian Banks, It Says
headline.main: Dubai Bank Says It Cut Ties With Iranian Institutions
headline.print_headline: Dubai Bank Reduces Ties With Iran, It Reports
